cyclone.name: FLORENCE
cyclone.current_location: about 975 miles ESE of Cape Fear, North Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking west-northwest to northwest across the southwest Atlantic, aiming toward the coasts of North and South Carolina late Thursday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the North Carolina–South Carolina border (around Cape Fear area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Edisto Beach, SC northward to the North Carolina–Virginia border, including the Pamlico and Albemarle Sounds
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire South Carolina and North Carolina coastline, with greatest impacts expected from Edisto Beach, SC to Cape Lookout, NC
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (34-63 kt) possible late Thursday into Friday with a small (≈9%) chance of sustained 50-kt winds; gusts could be higher in squalls.
weather_observation.storm_surge: NHC storm-surge watch indicates 2–4 ft above ground level from Edisto Beach to Murrells Inlet, which includes Charleston Harbor.
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rainfall bands could bring 6–10 inches with locally higher totals, creating flash-flood risk in and around the port.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf, rip currents, and possible coastal erosion that may impede vessel movements and quayside operations.
